organization.$: A. P. Shah Institute of Technology
S. G. G. S. Institute of Engineering and Technology

head.citation-title: Heuristics approach to speeding up saliency detection
head.abstracts: Â© 2018, Springer-Verlag London Ltd., part of Springer Nature. Visual saliency is the distinct perceptual quality which makes some subsets in an image stand out from their neighbours and immediately grab human attention in the early vision. Visual saliency is useful in locating the region of interest. Quick visual saliency detection is desirable in an application that uses the region of interest. The paper embeds a new heuristic module in the original hypercomplex Fourier transform based model. It allows generating saliency maps falling in the search path only, and hence reduces the number of intermediate saliency maps from N to average value log 2 N+ 1. Ultimately, speed up the original saliency model significantly.
